text:
I'm trying to get the package "GraphViz" (<https://github.com/Keno/GraphViz.jl>). When I tri `Pkg.add("GraphViz")` I get an error:
```The following package names could not be resolved:
 * GraphViz (not found in project, manifest or registry)```
Is this one of those cases where a package is not properly registered and one has to get it separately somehow? I thought I could use something like:
```Pkg.add(url="<https://github.com/Keno/GraphViz.jl>")```
but this generates a
```could not find project file in package at `<https://github.com/Keno/GraphViz.jl>` maybe `subdir` needs to be specified```
exactly how do I do this?

elements.text: I'm trying to get the package "GraphViz" (

could not find project file in package at `

text: Looks like that's an old Package that still uses a `REQUIRE` file rather than a `Project.toml` file

elements.text: Looks like that's an old Package that still uses a `REQUIRE` file rather than a `Project.toml` file

text: You could start from <https://github.com/Keno/GraphViz.jl/pull/32> but it might require some fixing to make it work on post-1.0 Julia.
